{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3307710,"name":"FredK","username":"FredK","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/71e660/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-12T17:16:31.777Z","cooked":"

We need to power the following items so it appears something needs to go into our REV Mini PM.
Radio PM
Rio
Switch
TOF Sensor
Limelight
We do not have a VRM or any other devices to distribute power.
The documentation we have found does not give options other than the PDH for the items on our list and we are a little confused on which of these are susceptible to damage from unregulated power. We cannot afford to replace any of the items and want to be careful. Thank you.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-02-12T17:16:31.777Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":338,"reads":248,"readers_count":247,"score":1729.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":454445,"topic_slug":"what-is-safe-to-plug-into-a-rev-mini-power-module","display_username":"FredK","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31768,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-is-safe-to-plug-into-a-rev-mini-power-module/454445/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3307719,"name":"Jon Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-12T17:21:40.217Z","cooked":"

Pay attention to R615, R616, and R617 - you need to power the Rio and Radio from designated ports, so you can’t use those with the MPM. Assuming you don’t run into any current limits with the breakers, there shouldn’t be any electrical reason the MPM won’t work for your TOF Sensor or Limelight.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-02-12T17:21:40.217Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":236,"readers_count":235,"score":107.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":454445,"topic_slug":"what-is-safe-to-plug-into-a-rev-mini-power-module","display_username":"Jon Stratis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7968,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-safe-to-plug-into-a-rev-mini-power-module/454445/2","custom_user_title":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3307737,"name":"","username":"FinIce","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/finice/{size}/270519_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-12T17:42:30.653Z","cooked":"

RIO and Radio need to go straight from the smaller ports on the PDH/PDP.

Basically everything else that doesn’t draw more than 15 amps can be going off the MPM.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-02-12T17:42:30.653Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":199,"readers_count":198,"score":64.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":454445,"topic_slug":"what-is-safe-to-plug-into-a-rev-mini-power-module","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52870,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Amateur Historian?"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-safe-to-plug-into-a-rev-mini-power-module/454445/3","custom_user_title":"Amateur Historian?","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3307746,"name":"acastagna","username":"acastagna","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a88e4f/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-12T17:49:33.649Z","cooked":"

We are powering our radio using the Rev Radio Power Module. If I want to power the radio by the barrel jack as a backup, would I need to add a VRM for the barrel jack? R617 doesn’t seem to make an exception for backup power.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-02-12T17:49:33.649Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":171,"readers_count":170,"score":54.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":454445,"topic_slug":"what-is-safe-to-plug-into-a-rev-mini-power-module","display_username":"acastagna","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7968,"username":"Jon_Stratis","name":"Jon Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-is-safe-to-plug-into-a-rev-mini-power-module/454445/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3307747,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-12T17:50:22.675Z","cooked":"

Correct answer: you’re using the RPM. No barrel jack allowed, by rule.

Legal Options for Wiring your Robot Radio in 2022 General Forum
I threw this together to hopefully help others understand the legal methods to wire their robot radios for this competition season: [RadioPower - Export Frame] Hopefully it helps others given the questions that have come up in the Q&A about legal robot radio wiring.

Those are still the only methods that are legal for this year.

R616 is actually what you’re looking at - the radio is powered by either the VRM or the RPM, not both.

I see- there’s an “either” in the rule

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-02-12T18:08:08.059Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":123,"readers_count":122,"score":44.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":454445,"topic_slug":"what-is-safe-to-plug-into-a-rev-mini-power-module","display_username":"acastagna","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-is-safe-to-plug-into-a-rev-mini-power-module/454445/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3307765,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-12T18:10:29.230Z","cooked":"

I’d run RPM/RIO/switch from the three unswitched low-current ports (20-22) on the PH. Then, I might use the switched port (23) for the Mini-PM – just be sure to have code to turn this port on in your initialization logic. If you have a free high-current port (0-19), use that instead. You should be able to power sensors/Limelights from there.
